string-array.name: create_simple_page
string-array.item: POST: Create a simple page using HTML
Create a simple page using HTML to describe the page content (under default section)

string-array.name: create_page_with_image
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with an image
Create a page with some formatted text and an image

string-array.name: create_page_with_web_page_snapshot
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with a snapshot of an embedded web page
Create a page with a snapshot of the HTML of a web page on it

string-array.name: create_page_with_url_snapshot
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with a snapshot of a URL
Create a page with a snapshot of the OneNote.com homepage on it.

string-array.name: meta_specific_page
string-array.item: GET: Get metadata of a specific page
Following the previous example, first we get a paginated list of all pages and then query the metadata for one of the selected pages. Please select a specific page from the drop-down below

string-array.name: specific_title
string-array.item: GET: Get pages with a specific title

Query for a paginated list of pages that contain a given title substring. This example shows how to use the $filter=contains(title, \'<term>\') query parameter. Please enter a case-sensitive title substring in the TextBox below.

string-array.name: pages_selected_meta
string-array.item: GET: Get a sorted list of pages with selected metadata

Get a sorted list of pages using the $orderBy=title asc query parameter and only specific metadata in the response using the $select=id,title query parameter. $orderBy can be used to specify your custom sort order

string-array.name: page_append
string-array.item: PATCH: Append to the end of the default outline in the page
Add new trailing content to the default outline in an existing page

string-array.name: pages_specific_section
string-array.item: GET: Get a list of all pages under a specific section
Queries for all the pages that belong to a specific section

string-array.name: create_page_with_pdf
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with a PDF attachment rendered
Create a page with a PDF file attachment rendered

string-array.name: create_page_with_note_tags
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with note tags
Create a page with examples of note tags. For example build a to do list

string-array.name: create_page_with_business_cards
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with a business card
Create a page with a business card info automatically extracted from an image

string-array.name: create_page_with_recipe
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with a recipe
Create a page with a cooking recipe automatically extracted from an example webpage

string-array.name: create_page_with_product_info
string-array.item: POST: Create a page with product info
Create a page with a product info automatically extracted from an example amazon.com webpage

string-array.name: create_page_under_named_section
string-array.item: POST: Create a page under a named section
Create a page under a given section name using the \'sectionName\' query parameter. Please enter a section name in the TextBox below. If the named section does not exist, it will be auto-created

string-array.name: get_all_pages
string-array.item: GET: Get a list of all pages

Queries for all pages in OneNote and returns a paginated list. By default, paging returns the first 20 pages ordered by last modified time descending (default sort order). The @odata.nextLink in the Response or $skip and $top query parameters can be used to retrieve the next set of pages

string-array.name: get_pages_skip_and_top
string-array.item: GET: Get pages using query with $skip and $top params
Since the list of pages returned is paginated, this example shows how to use the $skip=20&$top=3 query parameters to get up to 3 additional pages after the first 20 pages

string-array.name: search_all_pages
string-array.item: Search all pages and return the paginated list of matching pages that contain the given search term (case-insensitive search)

string-array.name: get_page_as_html
string-array.item: GET: Recall a page\'s content as HTML
First we get a paginated list of all pages and then return back the content of one of the selected pages as HTML
